III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
1

limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date between 11/20/2024 and 01/02/2025, a
youth did not feel safe at a facility after a staff member hit them.
The youth was unable to report if there were resulting injuries. The
youth could provide a first name of the staff member that hit them,
but no additional details.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 02/27/2025 by phone.
Complainant stated Youth A identified a male staff by first name
that punched him while he was at Wolverine Center. Complainant
stated this male staff may be the same male staff in a current
investigation, 2025SIC0000208, involving Youth A at Wolverine
Center.
Youth A was discharged from Wolverine Center on 01/02/2025.
Youth A was interviewed at his current placement. Youth A stated
he did not have concerns with his placement at Wolverine Center.
Youth A stated he knew the staff identified by his first name in the
allegation. Youth A denied physical contact with this Wolverine
Center staff. Youth A also denied physical contact with any
Wolverine Center staff.
Former Staff (FS) was interviewed on 03/04/2025 by phone
because he is the only recent former staff and current Wolverine
Center staff with the same first name as identified in this
allegation. FS stated his last day of work at Wolverine Center was
12/22/2024. FS stated he recalled Youth A. FS did not recall being
involved in a physical contact incident with Youth A.
Documentation
Youth A was last placed at Wolverine Center from 11/20/2024 to
01/02/2025. A search of MiSACWIS incident reports found one
report with Youth A and the staff identified in this allegation. The
incident occurred on 12/15/2024 when Youth A truanted at 12:35
PM and the staff identified in this investigation lost line of sight at
12:50 PM.
One of the allegations in 2025SIC0000208 alleges Youth A was
punched in the shoulder by a male staff. The male staff in
2025SIC0000208 does not have the same first name as the male
2

staff identified in this investigation. It was not found in
2025SIC0000208 that Youth A was punched by a male staff.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with not physically punishing
Youth A. Youth A denied physical contact with the staff identified
by his first name in this investigation.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
